resources.string: Ancef
Aspirin
Ativan
Avelox
Benadryl
Cipro
Catapres
Decadron
Digoxin
Diprivan
Dilaudid
Haldol
Heparin
Lasix
Lopressor
Lovenox
Morphine
Motrin
Nitroglycerin
Percocet
Phenergan
Plavix
Prednisone
Reglan
Rocephin
Solu-medrol
Tylenol
Toradol
Unasyn
Valium
Vicodin
Zithromax
Zofran
Zosyn
(cefazolin) is a cephalosporin antibiotic. It is used to treat bacterial infections. It may also used before or during surgery to prevent infection.
(acetylsalicylic acid) is used to treat pain, fevers, and reduce inflammation. It also has secondary uses such as preventing heart attacks, strokes and chest pains if prescribed by a doctor.
(lorazepam) is a benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety disorders. It may also be used for nausea, migraines and seizures.
(moxifloxacin) is an antibiotic in the group of drugs called fluoroquinolone. This drug fights infection on the skin, in the sinuses, lungs or stomach.
(diphenhydramine) is an antihistamine used to treat allergy symptoms, hives, rashes and also can be used to help with sleep or migraines.
(ciprofloxacin) is an antibiotic from the group called fluoroquinolones. It is a type of medicine that treats different bacterial infections in the body.
(clonidine) is a alpha agonist. It is mainly used to treat high blood pressure but may also be used for alcohol, nicotine, or benzodiazepine withdrawal as well as migraines.
(dexamethasone) is used to treat inflammation in the body. It can be used for things such as swelling, allergic reactions, asthma, kidney problems, skin conditions, or flare-ups of MS.
(lanoxin) is used to help treat heart failure as well as treat atrial fibrillation. It makes the heart beat much stronger and more regular.
(propofol) is used during general anesthesia for procedures or anesthesia. It is also used in an ER or ICU setting while patients are using a breathing tube and ventilator for sedation.
(hydromorphone) is opioid pain medication used to treat moderate to severe pain.
(haloperidol) is an antipsychotic medicine used to treat schizophrenia, control motor and speak tics in Tourette’s syndrome and also used to control nausea.
is an anticoagulant (blood thinner) which prevents formation of blood clots in the veins, arteries or lungs.

(furosemide) is a loop diuretic which treats water retention. Most commonly referred to as a “water pill”, it is used in those with CHF (congestive heart failure), liver disease, kidney disorders and high blood pressure.

(metoprolol) is in the class called beta blockers. It is used to treat chest pain, high blood pressure and heart failure. Using this medication to lower blood pressure can help to prevent strokes, kidney problems and heart attacks.

(enoxaparin) is an anticoagulant medication which helps prevent formation of blood clots. It is also used to treat and/or prevent deep vein thrombosis (DVT) as well as blood clots in the lungs (pulmonary embolisms).
is an narcotic pain reliever used for moderate or severe pain. It can be taken orally, through an IV or as an injection into the muscle.
(ibuprofen) is an NSAID (nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug) used to treat pain, reduce inflammation and reduce fevers.
(Nitro-bid) is a nitrate used to prevent chest pain (angina) which occurs when the heart does not get enough blood. It dilates the blood vessels to make it easier for blood to reach the heart.
(endocet) is an opioid pain medication with both acetaminophen (tylenol) an oxycodone. It is used to treat moderate to severe pain.
(promethazine) is a medication used to help treat and prevent nausea and vomiting. It can also be used to help with sleep or with allergic symptoms like rash or itching.
(clopidogrel) helps prevent unwanted blood clots. It is primarily used to prevent blood clots after a heart attack or stroke.
is a corticosteroid which prevents inflammation. This oral medication is mainly used for skin conditions, arthritis, breathing disorders, or allergic reactions.
(metoclopramide) is a medication that speeds up how fast the stomach empties. It also may be used for heartburn or nausea and vomiting.
(ceftriaxone) is a cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of infections in the body.

(methylprednisolone) is a steroid which prevents inflammation. Given through an IV, this medication is used to treat arthritis, ulcerative colitis, nervous system disorders, lung conditions and many other allergic disorders.
(acetaminophen) is used to treat pain and fevers.
(ketorolac) is an NSAID (nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug) which reduces the pain and inflammation in the body.
(ampicillin and sulbactam) is a combination antibiotic that are used to fight against bacteria in the body.
(diazepam) is a benzodiazepine, used to treat anxiety, alcohol withdrawal, or muscle spasms.
(lortab) is an opioid pain medication with both acetaminophen (tylenol) and hydrocodone. It is used to treat moderate to severe pain.
(azithromycin) is an antibiotic used to treat lung infections such as pneumonia, skin infections, ear infections and pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) in women.
(ondansetron) is used to prevent or treat nausea and vomiting.

(piperacillin & tazobactam) is combination antibiotic used to fight against bacertia in the body. It is commonly used for urinary tract infections, joint infections, skin infections, pneumonia as well as infections in the stomach. It is not uncommon to receive Zosyn in conjunction with other antibiotics.
